qa_pairs.question: What mergers and acquisitions did Brookfield Residential undertake between 2011 and 2018, and how did these activities align with its strategic initiatives during that period?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Brookfield Residential undertook a merger in 2011 when Brookfield Homes Corporation and Brookfield Office Properties merged to form Brookfield Residential Properties Inc.<cite>[S5]</cite></statement> <statement>In 2015, Brookfield Residential acquired Grand Haven Homes, an Austin, Texas, homebuilder, and purchased Albi Homes, expanding its homebuilding operations.<cite>[S7][S8]</cite></statement> <statement>In February 2018, Brookfield Residential acquired assets of OliverMcMillan, a San Diego-based developer of large-scale mixed-use properties, further diversifying its portfolio.<cite>[S11]</cite></statement> <statement>These activities aligned with strategic initiatives such as participating in affordable housing projects with the Government of Alberta in 2015 and advancing sustainable construction practices, including the development of a passive house in 2017 to promote energy-efficient building standards.<cite>[S9][S10]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] Brookfield Residential


# Brookfield Residential



**Brookfield Residential Properties Inc.** is a Canadian real estate developer that has its headquarters in Calgary, Alberta. [S2] Total assets were $4.5 billion as of June 2018. [S3] ## History

Brookfield Residential was founded in 1956. [S4] Brookfield Residential Properties Inc. [S5] was formed on March 31, 2011, when Brookfield Homes Corporation ("Brookfield Homes") and Brookfield Office Properties (consisting of Carma Developers and Brookfield Homes (Ontario) Limited) merged.ˢᵉˡᶠ-ᵖᵘᵇˡⁱˢʰᵉᵈ ˢᵒᵘʳᶜᵉ? [S6] In 2015, Brookfield Asset Management purchased 32.4 million common shares of Brookfield Residential in a privatization effort.ˢᵉˡᶠ-ᵖᵘᵇˡⁱˢʰᵉᵈ ˢᵒᵘʳᶜᵉ? [S7] In March 2015, Brookfield Residential Properties announced the acquisition of Grand Haven Homes, an Austin, Texas, homebuilder.ˢᵉˡᶠ-ᵖᵘᵇˡⁱˢʰᵉᵈ ˢᵒᵘʳᶜᵉ? [S8] In October 2015, Brookfield Residential purchased builder Albi Homes. [S9] That year Brookfield Residential Properties participated in an initiative with other home builders, and the Government of Alberta to create affordable housing for homeless Calgarians. [S10] In 2017, Brookfield Residential Properties constructed a passive house in an effort to educate its trade suppliers on construction methods to meet Passive House Institute standards. [S11] In February 2018, it acquired some of the assets of San Diego–based real estate company OliverMcMillan, a developer of large-scale mixed use properties. [S12] Brookfield Residential Properties was awarded the 2018 Lowest HERS Index Score Canadian Production Builder with a HERS Index Score of 38 as part of the 2018 RESNET Cross Border Home Builder Challenge, which helps promote the utilization of the HERS Index. [S13] On September 14, 2018, Calgary's Seton YMCA was renamed Brookfield Residential YMCA at Seton after a $3.5 million investment In August 2020, Brookfield Residential became one of the first victims of the DarkSide hacking group, leading to the stolen data being published on the dark web.
chunk_list:
[S1] Brookfield Residential


# Brookfield Residential



**Brookfield Residential Properties Inc.** is a Canadian real estate developer that has its headquarters in Calgary, Alberta. [S2] Total assets were $4.5 billion as of June 2018. [S3] ## History

Brookfield Residential was founded in 1956. [S4] Brookfield Residential Properties Inc. [S5] was formed on March 31, 2011, when Brookfield Homes Corporation ("Brookfield Homes") and Brookfield Office Properties (consisting of Carma Developers and Brookfield Homes (Ontario) Limited) merged.ˢᵉˡᶠ-ᵖᵘᵇˡⁱˢʰᵉᵈ ˢᵒᵘʳᶜᵉ? [S6] In 2015, Brookfield Asset Management purchased 32.4 million common shares of Brookfield Residential in a privatization effort.ˢᵉˡᶠ-ᵖᵘᵇˡⁱˢʰᵉᵈ ˢᵒᵘʳᶜᵉ? [S7] In March 2015, Brookfield Residential Properties announced the acquisition of Grand Haven Homes, an Austin, Texas, homebuilder.ˢᵉˡᶠ-ᵖᵘᵇˡⁱˢʰᵉᵈ ˢᵒᵘʳᶜᵉ? [S8] In October 2015, Brookfield Residential purchased builder Albi Homes. [S9] That year Brookfield Residential Properties participated in an initiative with other home builders, and the Government of Alberta to create affordable housing for homeless Calgarians. [S10] In 2017, Brookfield Residential Properties constructed a passive house in an effort to educate its trade suppliers on construction methods to meet Passive House Institute standards. [S11] In February 2018, it acquired some of the assets of San Diego–based real estate company OliverMcMillan, a developer of large-scale mixed use properties. [S12] Brookfield Residential Properties was awarded the 2018 Lowest HERS Index Score Canadian Production Builder with a HERS Index Score of 38 as part of the 2018 RESNET Cross Border Home Builder Challenge, which helps promote the utilization of the HERS Index. [S13] On September 14, 2018, Calgary's Seton YMCA was renamed Brookfield Residential YMCA at Seton after a $3.5 million investment In August 2020, Brookfield Residential became one of the first victims of the DarkSide hacking group, leading to the stolen data being published on the dark web.

First, I need to go through the supporting context provided. The passage has several sentences with citations. Let me scan through each one to find relevant info.

Then, looking at the years 2015 onwards. Sentence S7 says in March 2015, they acquired Grand Haven Homes, a homebuilder in Austin, Texas. That's an acquisition. Then in October 2015, sentence S8 mentions purchasing Albi Homes. Another acquisition. So those are two acquisitions in 2015.

In February 2018, sentence S11 states they acquired some assets of OliverMcMillan, a San Diego-based company. That's another acquisition. So three acquisitions in total: Grand Haven Homes, Albi Homes, and OliverMcMillan. The merger in 2011 is also relevant.

Now, the strategic initiatives. The question is how these activities aligned with their strategies. Looking at the context, in 2015, they participated in an initiative with the Government of Alberta to create affordable housing for homeless Calgarians (S9). This might align with strategic initiatives related to community development or social responsibility. 

In 2017, they constructed a passive house to educate suppliers on Passive House standards (S10). This could relate to sustainability or innovation in construction. The HERS Index award in 2018 (S12) might tie into their focus on energy efficiency. Also, the renaming of the YMCA in 2018 (S13) could be part of community investment.
